required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BioDay Registry: Data Collection Regarding the Use of New Systemic Treatment Options in Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: BioDay Registry: Prospective, Observational Data Collection Regarding the Use of New Systemic Treatment Options in Patients With Atopic Diseases in Daily Practice

brief_summary.textblock: The BioDay Registry aims to address the need for daily practice data regarding the effectiveness and safety of new systemic treatment options in patients with AD and effect on other atopic comorbidities in a multicenter setting. The registry already consists of several additional modules concerning atopic comorbidities, like food allergy and asthma, and a module for conjunctivitis during dupilumab treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to previous specified timepoints (16 weeks, 1 year, 2 year etc.)
primary_outcome.description: To assess the effectiveness of new treatments in adult and pediatric patients with AD using physician measured clinical eczema scores as well as patient-reported outcome measures.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Drug survival analysis, which is the length of time a patient continues to take a particular drug, will be performed every year, with cumulative results over the years.
primary_outcome.description: To study drug survival and identify factors that affect drug survival.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to previous specified timepoints (16 weeks, 1 year, 2 year etc.)
primary_outcome.description: To register objective and subjective side effects and to identify potential risk factors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize patient populations treated with new AD treatments in daily practice.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To collect data from daily practice regarding side effects (incidence, severity, risk factors, treatment options, etc.).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To study the usefulness of laboratory monitoring during treatment in daily practice, with emphasis on subpopulations (e.g. elderly patients, patients with pre-existing liver and/or renal disease).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To study the long-term safety risks including malignancies, pregnancy/paternity-related conditions, infections, and autoimmune diseases.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To prospectively collect data from daily practice regarding the effect of new treatment options for AD on comorbidities (for example atopic diseases like asthma, food allergy and rhinoconjunctivitis can improve from these new drugs as many target the Th2 axis).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Yearly from baseline up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To assess whether dose reduction of biologics can be achieved in patients with low AD activity.

study_pop.textblock: All adult and paediatric patients treated with new systemic treatments for AD will be asked for participation in the BioDay Registry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult and paediatric patients treated with new systemic treatments for AD will be asked for participation in the BioDay Registry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients are not eligible for enrolment in case of presumed inability to answer questionnaires or not willing to answer questionnaires and will be excluded.

overall_contact_backup.last_name: Jorien van der Schaft, MD, PhD

contact_backup.last_name: Jorien van der Schaft, MD, PhD
